articles.author: Syakir
articles.description:
Hey guys üëã, Syakir here!
Its been a while since my last post. I'm currently busy building app as an indiehacker. Now, i want to share about my latest project, Kattalog, an AI product photography SaaS.
This project is not the first of its kind, since there's already some similar tools out there. But i'm still building it anyway for these reasons:
An experiment & learning journey to become an AI engineer & SaaS builder
The app target market are ecommerce sellers, and I worked in Ecommerce industry for the last 5 years
Based on the initial research, the market is not saturated yet
The competitor apps are mostly very technical (require detailed prompts), and i try to fix this with different approach (image to image)
The story begins about 3 months ago in the end of February 2025, when i had a‚Ä¶
articles.title: I Built My 1st AI SaaS, It's Not as Hard as You Think

articles.author: Rally for Jira
articles.description:
Sprint planning is supposed to give you guardrails, clear, reasonable boundaries for what your team can actually deliver. 
But in practice? Most teams commit to 20‚Äì40% more work than they have the capacity to complete.
Not because they‚Äôre lazy or bad at math‚Äîbut because the system nudges them to do it.
Here‚Äôs what‚Äôs really driving overcommitment (and how to fix it):
Team members don‚Äôt feel safe pushing back.


You‚Äôre measuring story points, not outcomes.


You reward volume, not focus.


Leadership derails the sprint mid-flight.


You need micro rituals to reinforce this.



Add these weekly nudges:
üü£Week 3: Mid-sprint confidence check (again, 1‚Äì5)
Want to make this stick?
Run a collaborative capacity workshop.
Do this:
Align on hard buffers (10%) + soft stretch work (5‚Äì10%)
Get a shared number before planning starts
We have gone deeper into these in the full article: https://www.rallybetter.com/blog/why-agile-teams-overcommit-and-how-to-fix-it/?utm_source=linkedin&utm_medium=rally_social
articles.title: Why Agile Teams Overcommit and How to Fix It

articles.author: Arjen Schwarz
articles.description:
For a fresh perspective, it's often helpful to look at a problem or task from a different lens. Sometimes, this will be better; sometimes, it's just a good way to refresh and renew your interest in something you've been doing for a while. In this post, we'll be looking at how similar designing for the cloud is to writing a story. What are the similarities, what are some key differences, and how does that actually help in any way?
A long, long, time ago, in a galaxy far far away, a little hobbit lived in a hole in the ground. 
When you read the above sentence, you get an idea in your head about the story that is being told. Depending on the kind of stories you've experienced before, that idea will consist of spaceships and robots, or maybe dwarves, rings, and dragons1. Either way, that sing‚Ä¶
articles.title: Cloud Design as a Story

articles.author: Dinesh Dunukedeniya
articles.description:
What is Choreography in EDA?


In simple terms, choreography is a decentralized way for services to communicate through events without a central controller. Think of it like a dance where each participant knows their steps and reacts based on cues from others there‚Äôs no single conductor telling everyone what to do.
In the context of EDA:
Services produce and consume events.


Each service listens for relevant events and reacts accordingly.


There is no central orchestrator managing the process.



This pattern is sometimes also called Broker Topology, a term popularized by Mark Richards in Software Architecture Patterns (O‚ÄôReilly). The name highlights that services communicate indirectly through a message broker, which routes events but does not control the workflow.
Imagine an online sto‚Ä¶
articles.title: Understanding Choreography in Event-Driven Architecture (EDA)

articles.author: Gaming News
articles.description:
Pandemic Studios actually kicked off Battlefront 3 work right after Battlefront II, but LucasArts wanted a next-gen sequel in just one year to hit its marketing beats. Moving from PS2/Xbox to the then-new PS3/Xbox 360 meant tooling up from scratch, and Pandemic rightly asked for a full two-year cycle. Talks stalled, the project never got off the ground, and pandemic‚Äôs neat space-to-ground combat ideas stayed on the drawing board.
Lucasfilm then handed the reins to Free Radical Design‚Äîwho got 95% through their own Battlefront 3 before that too was canned‚Äîand Pandemic itself folded in 2009. Decades later we‚Äôre still waiting on a ‚Äútrue‚Äù Battlefront 3, with EA‚Äôs 2017 reboot Battlefront II standing in as the closest thing fans have.
articles.title: OG Star Wars Battlefront devs were asked to make Battlefront 3 in just one year, but Pandemic couldn't hit LucasArts' timeline

articles.author: Gaming News
articles.description:
TL;DR: A former Star Wars Battlefront 2 dev, Mats Helge Holm, says he and other ex-EA colleagues would love to ‚Äúget the band back together‚Äù and cook up Battlefront 3 now that the 2017 shooter‚Äôs fan base is booming again on Reddit and TikTok‚Äîeven though EA pulled support back in 2020.
Battlefront 2‚Äôs launch was marred by outrage over pay-to-unlock heroes (40 hours of grind for Darth Vader, anyone?), forcing EA to ditch its microtransactions after Disney stepped in. Since then, the game‚Äôs stellar visuals, free hero drops and tight gameplay have won over a passionate community‚Äîprompting whispers (and hope) of a true sequel.
articles.title: Star Wars Battlefront 2 devs want to ‚Äòget the band back together' to make Battlefront 3

At the center of this package is the most comprehensive look yet at AI‚Äôs growing power demand, if I do say so myself.¬† This data-heavy story is the result of over six months of reporting by me and my colleague James O‚ÄôDonnell‚Ä¶

articles.description: In 2003, engineers from Germany and Switzerland began building a bridge across the Rhine River simultaneously from both sides. Months into construction, they found that the two sides did not meet. The German side hovered 54 centimeters above the Swiss side. The misalignment occurred because the German engineers had measured elevation with a historic level‚Ä¶

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Zoltan Vardai
articles.description:
MARA Holdings, formerly Marathon Digital Holdings, has reached a new all-time high in Bitcoin mining revenue, fueled by Bitcoin‚Äôs recent surge to a record price.
The company‚Äôs annualized mining revenue exceeded $752 million on May 27, according to data from CryptoQuant, making it the most profitable day in the company‚Äôs history. Marathon is currently the world‚Äôs largest publicly traded Bitcoin (BTC) mining firm by market capitalization.  
‚ÄúQuarterly reports are slow. Onchain shows revenue in real time,‚Äù CryptoQuant founder and CEO Ki Young Ju wrote in a May 27 X post confirming the milestone.¬†
Marathon‚Äôs record revenue surge occurred days after Bitcoin rose to a new all-time high of $112,000 for the first time on May 22, a development attributed by some analysts to Japanese bond market tur‚Ä¶
articles.title: MARA‚Äôs Bitcoin mining revenue hits record $752M as BTC price soars

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ezra Reguerra
articles.description:
Blockchain company StarkWare has unveiled zero-knowledge (ZK) prover STARK Two (S-two), enabling enhanced privacy and verification on everyday devices like phones, laptops and browsers.¬†
The company said the new ZK prover allows users to generate complex cryptographic proofs from the client side. This means users can generate ZK-proofs directly on their devices instead of relying on a server or cloud infrastructure, opening the door for faster and more private applications across the internet.¬†
‚ÄúS-two will bring STARK proving to everyday devices, and open the door for new real-world proving use cases,‚Äù said Eli Ben-Sasson, StarkWare co-founder and CEO, adding that the tool could empower the next wave of ZK applications.¬†
The company said the ZK prover is now available in public alpha and i‚Ä¶
articles.title: StarkWare launches mobile-friendly zero-knowledge prover

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Sam Bourgi
articles.description:
Fintech companies Taurus and Parafin have partnered to deliver blockchain infrastructure to financial institutions in Europe and Latin America ‚Äî a move aimed at accelerating the adoption of crypto custody and settlement services across both regions.
As part of the partnership, Taurus has integrated its product suite into Parafin‚Äôs institutional platform, creating an end-to-end solution for digital asset management, including custody, governance, and compliant token issuance, the companies announced on May 27.
Financial institutions using the integrated Taurus-Parafin solution will gain access to custody and tokenization services, real-time wallet execution and a full range of trading capabilities.
Taurus is an enterprise digital asset custody and tokenization solution that enables business‚Ä¶
articles.title: Taurus, Parafin partnership to provide crypto infrastructure to institutions

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Helen Partz
articles.description:
Circle, the issuer of USDC, the second-largest stablecoin by market capitalization, has launched an initial public offering (IPO) of 24 million shares of its Class A common stock, the company said on May 27.
The firm has applied to list its Class A common stock on the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) under the ticker symbol CRCL. As part of the offering, Circle is issuing 9.6 million shares of Class A common stock, the company said in a news release.
The remaining 14.4 million shares of Class A common stock will be offered by selling stockholders. Circle is also expected to grant the underwriters a 30-day option to buy up to an additional 3.6 million shares of Class A common stock to cover over-allotments.
The IPO involves participation from several major US investment banks, with JPMorgan, Citigroup and Goldman Sachs acting as joint lead active bookrunners, the announcement added.
The offering will also feature European banks, including Barclays, Deutsche Bank Securities and Societe Generale acting as bookrunners.
The IPO‚Äôs co-managers include BNY Capital Markets, Canaccord Genuity, Needham, Oppenheimer and Santander, while junior co-managers are represented by AmeriVet Securities, Drexel Hamilton, Mischler Financial Group and Roberts and Ryan.
This is a developing story, and further information will be added as it becomes available.
articles.title: USDC issuer Circle moves forward with initial public offering on NYSE

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Helen Partz
articles.description:
The United Kingdom is leading the world in increasing cryptocurrency ownership among its population in 2025, outpacing economies including the United States, according to a new study by Gemini.
Gemini, the US-based crypto exchange founded by Cameron and Tyler Winklevoss, on May 27 released its latest ‚ÄúState of Crypto‚Äù report, giving insights into changes in the global adoption of cryptocurrencies like Bitcoin (BTC).
Based on a survey of 7,200 adults across the US, Europe, Singapore and Australia, the report found that Europe has been leading the way in growing crypto ownership, with the UK in front.
The UK saw the biggest year-over-year growth in crypto ownership of the surveyed nations, with the share of respondents indicating crypto holdings rising to 24% as of April from 18% last year, ‚Ä¶
articles.title: UK outpaces global crypto ownership growth in 2025: Gemini report

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Nancy Lubale
articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Bitcoin‚Äôs RSI has dropped 15% and is now below the overbought threshold.

Bitcoin futures flip bearish with a 43% decline in perpetual CVD.

Analysts predict Bitcoin could reach $150,000 as long as a key support level holds.

Bitcoin‚Äôs (BTC) price hit fresh all-time highs of nearly $112,000 on May 23, gaining 50% from its April 1 lows. According to analysts, BTC price is now ‚Äúshowing signs of easing momentum‚Äù as it consolidates.¬†
Bitcoin‚Äôs rally to $111K triggered buyer fatigue
BTC‚Äôs recent run to $111,000 pushed the daily relative strength index (RSI) into the overbought zone at 79.6. However, ‚Äúsigns of easing momentum‚Äù have emerged as the RSI dropped by 15% to 67, said market intelligence firm Glassnode in its latest report, adding:
‚ÄúThis decline may signal cooling buyer ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin shows signs of 'easing momentum' but traders still expect $150K

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Adrian Zmudzinski
articles.description:
Luxembourg classified virtual asset service providers (VASPs) as high-risk entities for money laundering in its 2025 National Risk Assessment (NRA), highlighting concerns over the crypto industry‚Äôs exposure to financial crime.
According to the report, the inherent risk level of VASPs is deemed ‚ÄúHigh,‚Äù driven by factors including transaction volume, client reach, distribution channels, legal structures and the international scope of operations.
The NRA identified VASPs as an emerging risk in its 2020 report after ‚Äúa detailed assessment of ML inherent risks emerging from virtual assets.‚Äù This was followed by a 2022 NRA report deeming ‚Äúthe risks associated with crypto assets and virtual currencies as very high,‚Äù because, among other things, they are internet-based and cross-border.
Related: B‚Ä¶
articles.title: Luxembourg flags crypto companies as high risk for money laundering

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Zoltan Vardai
articles.description:
Japanese investment firm Metaplanet‚Äôs Bitcoin premium has reached almost $600,000 per coin, as Asia‚Äôs leading Bitcoin treasury firm pushes forward with its plan to purchase 21,000 BTC by 2026.
Metaplanet‚Äôs stockholders are paying more than a fivefold premium on Bitcoin (BTC) when investing in the Japanese company, according to a report by 10x Research published on May 27.
‚ÄúA little-known Japanese stock trades as if Bitcoin were worth $596,154, more than five times its actual price,‚Äù the report states.
Investors who don‚Äôt understand the importance of a firm‚Äôs net asset value (NAV) may be ‚Äúdramatically overpaying for their Bitcoin exposure‚Äù on a position that doesn‚Äôt provide additional upside leverage, the report adds.
The NAV represents the per-unit price of a fund, calculated by dividing t‚Ä¶
articles.title: Metaplanet‚Äôs Bitcoin ‚Äòpremium‚Äô nears $600K per BTC

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Ezra Reguerra
articles.description:
Crypto exchange Bitget has entered the expanding market for crypto investment products with the launch of BGUSD, a yield-bearing stable asset backed by tokenized real-world assets.
The company announced that BGUSD offers an annual yield of 4%, which is credited daily to users‚Äô spot accounts. Subscriptions to BGUSD can be made using either USDC (USDC) or USDt (USDT), and the asset is redeemable back to USDC on demand.
The company said the yield is derived from a basket of tokenized instruments, including US Treasury bills and high-grade money-market funds. ‚ÄúThese assets are managed via partnerships with regulated institutional tokenization providers such as Superstate,‚Äù Bitget CEO Gracy Chen told Cointelegraph.
The product‚Äôs structure is designed to reduce exposure to crypto volatility whil‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitget enters real-world asset race with yield-bearing BGUSD stable asset

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Blockchain.com is stepping up its presence in Africa, targeting markets where governments are beginning to implement crypto regulations.
The UK-based exchange plans to open a physical office during the second quarter in Nigeria ‚Äî its ‚Äúfastest-growing market‚Äù in West Africa ‚Äî along with broader expansion efforts in Ghana, Kenya and South Africa, according to a May 27 report by Bloomberg.
‚ÄúNigeria has taken meaningful steps toward creating a clear framework for crypto,‚Äù Owenize Odia, Blockchain.com‚Äôs general manager for Africa, reportedly said.
The move comes as global sentiment shifts, including political tailwinds from the United States, where President Donald Trump‚Äôs pro-crypto stance has encouraged industry expansion.
Related: Hedera Africa Hackathon launches with $1M prize pool and Web3‚Ä¶
articles.title: Blockchain.com expands in Africa as local crypto rules take shape

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Onkar Singh
articles.description:
Why are central banks looking at blockchains?            
            
                
Central banks are tiptoeing into the world of blockchain not because it is fashionable but because every part of the money-making machine, from settlement rails to asset custody, is slowly being rewritten as code.
The financial industry is already tokenizing money-market funds, Treasurys and even bank deposits. According to the Atlantic Council, 134 jurisdictions are studying or piloting a central bank digital currency (CBDC), up from just 35 in 2020.¬†
Meanwhile, commercial banks have begun to warn that if they cannot move tokenized deposits across public blockchains such as Solana or private ledgers like R3 Corda, they risk being left behind.
From a central bank‚Äôs vantage point, two questions matter:

‚Ä¶
articles.title: How central banks are testing blockchain-based monetary policy

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Amin Haqshanas
articles.description:
Thailand is preparing to let tourists spend cryptocurrency via credit card-linked platforms as part of a broader strategy to modernize its financial system and embrace digital assets.
The plan was announced by Deputy Prime Minister and Finance Minister Pichai Chunhavajira during an investment seminar in Bangkok on May 26, according to reports from Bangkok Post and The Nation. 
The initiative, currently under review by the Ministry of Finance and the Bank of Thailand, will enable tourists to link their crypto holdings to credit cards for local purchases.
Merchants will receive Thai baht as usual, often without knowing crypto was used in the transaction. The pilot is expected to roll out after key infrastructure and regulatory checks are in place.
‚ÄúThis approach can be immediately adapted fo‚Ä¶
articles.title: Thailand to allow crypto spending for tourists, eyes regulatory reform

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Tarang Khaitan
articles.description:
French authorities have arrested more than 12 people who have been linked to two high-profile crypto kidnapping cases in Paris, France, local media reports.
Those arrested include several minors, with charges against them including kidnapping, attempted kidnapping and criminal conspiracy, Le Parisien reported on May 26.
French investigators are exploring the possibility that a criminal organization is behind two recent crypto-linked kidnapping cases, with social media networks being used for recruitment.
In one recent alleged kidnapping attempt on May 13, three men tried to snatch the daughter and grandson of Pierre Noizat, the co-founder and CEO of French crypto exchange Paymium, in broad daylight in Paris.
That attempt, which bystanders captured on video, shows that the alleged attempt w‚Ä¶
articles.title: France arrests over 12 suspects linked to crypto kidnappings: Report

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
Four artificial intelligence-enhanced robots have been put through their paces in a Chinese robot fighting competition, duking it out in kickboxing matches until one was declared the champion.
The World Robot Competition Mecha Fighting Series had four human-controlled robots built by China-based firm Unitree compete in three, two-minute rounds with winners crowned through a points system, according to a May 26 report from the China state-owned outlet the Global Times.¬†
Chen Xiyun, a Unitree team member, said the ‚Äúrobots fight in a human-machine collaborative way,‚Äù with the machines pre-taught moves, but ultimately, a person controls the bot‚Äôs movements.

The robots reportedly weighed 35 kilograms and stood 132 centimeters tall. Ahead of the boxing rounds, the pint-sized robots were put thr‚Ä¶
articles.title: Humanoid AI-powered robots duke it out in China fight comp

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Sam Bourgi
articles.description:
Christopher Giancarlo, former chairman of the US Commodity Futures Trading Commission (CFTC), has joined Sygnum in an advisory role, where he will help the crypto bank navigate global regulations amid growing institutional interest in digital assets.¬†
Giancarlo‚Äôs appointment as senior policy adviser places him alongside 11 other members of Sygnum‚Äôs Advisory Council, the company disclosed on May 27.
In his role, Giancarlo will advise on regulations and strategic partnerships in both the public and private sectors.¬†
Sygnum is a Swiss banking group dedicated to providing crypto asset services. It‚Äôs often called the first digital asset bank, having recently achieved unicorn status following a $58 million funding round.¬†
Giancarlo, who headed the CFTC between 2017 and 2019, said he is joining S‚Ä¶
articles.title: Former CFTC Chair Christopher Giancarlo joins crypto bank Sygnum

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
Bitcoin markets recently experienced two major liquidation events, causing a cascade of forced selling from over-leveraged traders, but analysts say a distinct pattern has emerged.
‚ÄúOverleveraged short-term traders were flushed out, long-term holders have been quietly capitalizing on the reset,‚Äù CryptoQuant analyst Amr Taha said on May 26.¬†
They noted the first flush occurred when Bitcoin (BTC) fell below $111,000, and over $97 million in long positions were liquidated. As its price broke $109,000, another $88 million in longs were wiped out in the second wave.
However, as short-term traders faced margin calls and forced selling, long-term holders (LTH) responded very differently and increased their accumulation.
This caused the long-term holder realized capitalization to surge past $28 bi‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin long-term holders ‚Äòquietly capitalizing‚Äô with drop to $109K

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
The Instagram account of former US rap trio Migos was hacked in an apparent attempt to blackmail Solana co-founder Raj Gokal.
On May 27, Migos‚Äô Instagram account posted at least seven images seen by Cointelegraph that have since been deleted. Two of the images appeared to depict Gokal holding up his passport and driver‚Äôs license, clearly showing the full details of each document.
The account‚Äôs hacker tagged Gokal in one of the images that apparently showed him with the caption ‚Äúyou should‚Äôve paid the 40 btc,‚Äù while another image depicting Gokal was captioned ‚Äúit was only 40 btc.. should‚Äôve paid,‚Äù in what appears to be a references to a failed extortion attempt.
Another image posted by the account hacker shows what the caption claimed was Gokal‚Äôs wife holding up a driver‚Äôs license, while a ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Migos Instagram account hacked in apparent blackmail bid on Solana co-founder

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
Michael Saylor, the executive chair of major Bitcoin-buying firm Strategy, formerly MicroStrategy, says institutions posting onchain proof-of-reserves is a ‚Äúbad idea‚Äù that could pose security risks.
‚ÄúThe current, conventional way to publish proof of reserves is an insecure proof of reserves,‚Äù Saylor said when asked about institutions adopting the transparency measure at a May 26 event on the sidelines of the Bitcoin 2025 conference in Las Vegas.
‚ÄúIt actually dilutes the security of the issuer, the custodians, the exchanges and the investors. It‚Äôs not a good idea, it‚Äôs a bad idea.‚Äù
Saylor didn‚Äôt answer whether Strategy would publish its proof-of-reserves when asked by Blockware Solutions head analyst Mitchell Askew whether his firm would do so.

I asked @saylor if @MicroStrategy has any pla‚Ä¶
articles.title: Saylor says onchain proof-of-reserves a ‚Äòbad idea‚Äô due to security risks

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Martin Young
articles.description:
Current artificial intelligence models lack the major traits of human intelligence, Meta‚Äôs AI chief has reportedly said, claiming that the firm‚Äôs latest model will solve this issue.¬†
Business Insider reported on May 26 that at the AI Action Summit in Paris earlier this year, Meta chief AI scientist Yann LeCun said that ‚Äúthere are four essential characteristics of intelligent behavior that every animal, or relatively smart animal, can do, and certainly humans.‚Äù¬†
‚ÄúUnderstanding the physical world, having persistent memory, being able to reason and being able to plan complex actions, particularly planning hierarchically,‚Äù LeCun said.
He said current large language models (LLMs) that power popular AI chatbots have not hit this threshold, and ‚Äúincorporating these capabilities would require a sh‚Ä¶
articles.title: Meta‚Äôs AI boss says current AI lacks ‚Äòintelligent behavior‚Äô ‚Äî Report

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Stephen Katte
articles.description:
The Paris-based crypto company Blockchain Group is adding more Bitcoin to its growing treasury through a 63.3 million euro ($72 million) bond sale.
The company hopes to buy another 590 Bitcoin (BTC) with the funds, increasing its total holdings to 1,437 BTC, the Blockchain Group said on May 26.
Bitcoin is trading at over $109,00, and at current prices, the Blockchain Group could buy 658 BTC with the total amount it raised, according to CoinGecko.
However, the company said only 95% of the proceeds from the issuance will be used to buy Bitcoin; the remainder is marked for ‚Äúoperational expenses and to pay management fees.‚Äù
Source: Alexandre Laizet
Venture capital firm Fulgur Ventures invested the lion‚Äôs share for the bond sale, with 55.3 million euros ($62.9 million), while crypto private inv‚Ä¶
articles.title: France‚Äôs Blockchain Group to buy 590 Bitcoin after bond sale

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Brayden Lindrea
articles.description:
A second person suspected of being involved in a high-profile crypto kidnapping case in New York City is expected to turn himself in to police, according to several reports.
The second man is a Swiss crypto investor who allegedly assisted business partner Joel Woeltz, who is accused of kidnapping Michael Valentino Teofrasto Carturan and torturing him in a Soho apartment in an attempt to pressure him into revealing his crypto wallet phrase, ABC7 New York reported on May 26.
A separate NBC report said the Swiss trader ‚Äî¬† who is not named ‚Äî would turn himself over to police within a week. However, FOX5 New York reported that the man may already be in custody, citing conflicting sources.
The New York Post reported that the man is the co-founder of a Swiss trading firm.
Woeltz, known as the ‚Äúcr‚Ä¶
articles.title: Another suspect to surrender in NYC crypto torture case: Reports

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Adrian Zmudzinski
articles.description:
Bitlayer‚Äôs Bitcoin smart-contract system is being implemented by mining pools behind 31.5% of the network‚Äôs hashrate, a development that will help ensure that its system will operate on the Bitcoin blockchain, the company said.
According to a May 27 announcement shared with Cointelegraph, Bitlayer‚Äôs BitVM implementation will be supported by major Bitcoin (BTC) mining pools including Antpool, F2Pool, and SpiderPool. Antpool CEO Andy Chow said:
"Antpool has become the bridge operator for Bitlayer to support Bitcoin innovation and protect miners‚Äô interests.‚Äù
BitVM (Bitcoin Virtual Machine) is a framework that enables complex smart contracts to be deployed on the Bitcoin blockchain without changing the base protocol. The idea was introduced by Robin Linux in 2023, and allows for the complex co‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitlayer secures 31.5% of Bitcoin's hashrate to bring smart contracts to BTC

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Cointelegraph
articles.description:
Today in crypto, Bitcoin bull Michael Saylor has advised against proof-of-reserves, Dubai has launched the Middle East‚Äôs first tokenized real estate project, and a crypto investor lost $2.6 million across two phishing scams.
Saylor says onchain proof-of-reserves a ‚Äòbad idea‚Äô
Michael Saylor, the executive chair of major Bitcoin-buying firm Strategy, formerly MicroStrategy, said on May 26 that institutions posting onchain proof-of-reserves is a ‚Äúbad idea‚Äù that poses security risks.
‚ÄúThe current, conventional way to publish proof of reserves is an insecure proof of reserves,‚Äù Saylor said when asked¬†by Blockware Solutions head analyst Mitchell Askew at an event about institutions adopting the measure. ‚ÄúIt actually dilutes the security of the issuer, the custodians, the exchanges and the invest‚Ä¶
articles.title: Here‚Äôs what happened in crypto today

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Christopher Tepedino
articles.description:
Dubai has launched the first licensed tokenized real estate project in the Middle East and North Africa (MENA) region, previewing appetite for real-world tokenization in one of the world‚Äôs burgeoning crypto hubs.
Partners in the project include the Dubai Land Department (DLD), the Central Bank of the United Arab Emirates, and the Dubai Future Foundation, according to an announcement from the Dubai government. The tokens will be tradeable on the newly launched ‚ÄúPrypco Mint‚Äù platform, with Zand Digital Bank appointed as the bank for the project‚Äôs pilot phase.
On May 19, Dubai‚Äôs Virtual Assets Regulatory Authority (VARA) updated its rules to include real-world asset (RWA) tokenization, allowing such tokens to be traded on secondary markets.
Related: UAE saw 41% increase in crypto app download‚Ä¶
articles.title: Dubai launches first licensed tokenized real estate project in MENA region

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Marcel Pechman
articles.description:
Key takeaways:

Bitcoin is stuck below $110,000 due to macroeconomic uncertainty and as Nvidia earnings anticipation caps risk appetite.

Strong spot BTC ETF inflows and Bitcoin options data are hints that US economic clarity could unlock BTC highs.

Investor sentiment improved on May 26 after US President Donald Trump postponed his retaliatory European Union 50% tariffs on imports. European stock markets responded positively to the development, but Bitcoin (BTC) was unable to hold the $110,000 level, leading traders to question whether a new all-time high remains within reach.
Even if Bitcoin revisits the $105,000 mark, rising institutional interest and robust derivatives markets indicate that bullish traders are neither overleveraged nor concerned about a potential correction.
Bitcoin 2-‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin stalls at $110K but institutional investors continue gobbling up BTC

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Alex O‚ÄôDonnell
articles.description:
Cryptocurrency industry groups are urging the US Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to issue formal guidance on staking, citing continued regulatory uncertainty for Web3 infrastructure providers, according to Allison Muehr, head of staking policy for the Crypto Council for Innovation, a trade group.
Clarifying the SEC‚Äôs position on staking has become a top priority for the crypto industry, Muehr said during Solana‚Äôs Accelerate conference in New York.
‚ÄúWe‚Äôre about 25% of the way there,‚Äù Muehr said. ‚ÄúThe SEC has done more constructive engagement with us in the past four months than in the last four years, but we still don‚Äôt have formal staking guidance.‚Äù
Allison Muehr, right, the Crypto Council for Innovation‚Äôs head of staking policy, speaks at Accelerate. Source: Cointelegraph
Related‚Ä¶
articles.title: Crypto industry urges SEC to clarify staking stance

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Rakesh Upadhyay
articles.description:
Key points:

Bitcoin ETPs continue to witness solid buying, signaling that the bulls expect the uptrend to continue.

Several major altcoins witnessed a pullback, but lower levels continue to attract buyers.

Bitcoin (BTC) is attempting to sustain above $109,588, indicating buying on every minor dip. Bitcoin has risen for seven consecutive weeks, and if buyers can extend the streak to eight weeks, it clears the path for further upside. Crypto analyst and trader Carpe Noctom said in a post on X that Bitcoin has only seen three instances of eight consecutive weekly positive closes, and every time, Bitcoin has been higher in the following six- and 12-month time period.
Institutional investors sense a long-term opportunity and, hence, have continued to pump money into Bitcoin exchange-traded p‚Ä¶
articles.title: Price predictions 5/26: SPX, DXY, BTC, ETH, XRP, BNB, SOL, DOGE, ADA, HYPE

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Christopher Tepedino
articles.description:
Update (May 26, 9:27 pm UTC): This article has been updated to include a statement from Truth Media and Technology Group.
Trump Media and Technology Group, the company behind US President Donald Trump‚Äôs Truth Social platform, has rebuffed a report that it‚Äôs planning to raise $3 billion in a mix of equity and convertible bonds to buy Bitcoin and other cryptocurrencies.
The Financial Times reported the company‚Äôs plan on May 26, citing six people briefed on the matter, but Trump Media told the outlet that, ‚Äúapparently the Financial Times has dumb writers listening to even dumber sources.‚Äù
Trump Media did not immediately respond to Cointelegraph‚Äôs request for comment.
If Trump Media implements the reported plan, it would position the company to follow the footsteps of crypto-buying companies l‚Ä¶
articles.title: Trump Media Group denies it‚Äôs raising $3B for crypto buys: Report

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Big Smokey
articles.description:
Key takeaways: 

Bitcoin price is capped at the $110,000 level due to sellers and a decrease in spot volumes. Leverage use is driving current rallies into this resistance level.

Traders are watching today‚Äôs volumes to see if emerging intraday trends are followed at the US open on May 27.

Bitcoin (BTC) price staged a mild recovery over the weekend, but gains above $110,000 are being capped by selling. Data from Glassnode shows ‚Äúnet distribution‚Äù (selling) from the cohort holding more than 10,000 Bitcoin, but cohorts below this level have continued to accumulate.¬†
Trend accumulation score. Source: X / Glassnode
The spot and futures cumulative volume delta at Binance exchange reflect persistent selling when BTC price approaches the $110,000 level.
BTC/USDT 4-hour chart CVD (spot and futures‚Ä¶
articles.title: Bitcoin bulls start Memorial Day blitz on $110K ‚Äî Will spot follow when US markets open?

articles.author: Cointelegraph by Sam Bourgi
articles.description:
Some of blockchain‚Äôs earliest adopters are now deeply ‚Äúentrenching‚Äù themselves in decentralized AI, with ecosystems like Bittensor (TAO) emerging as growth engines. These platforms are reshaping traditional venture capital models, enabling the best ideas to organically attract community support, staking and liquidity without the need for institutional gatekeepers.
That was one of the key takeaways from Cointelegraph‚Äôs interview with Chris Miglino, the co-founder and CEO of DNA Fund, a digital asset investment firm he runs alongside fellow serial entrepreneurs Brock Peirce and Scott Walker.
DNA Fund manages, among other things, five distinct funds across a range of strategies, such as a high-yield fund, an algorithmic trading fund, an AI compute fund, a liquid token fund and a venture fund ‚Ä¶
articles.title: Decentralized AI could be ‚Äòbigger than Bitcoin‚Äô ‚Äî DNA Fund CEO Chris Miglino
